event-group.description: WARNING: You probably don't want anyone knowing this information, because with this anyone can impersonate your game
event-group.title: API constants

sub-events.comment: ===Game Jolt
Get these at "Manage game > Game API > API Settings"
properties
bragging rights
Docs: https://gamejolt.com/game-api/doc/

event-group.description: The thing that makes it all work, sorta asynchronous
event-group.title: Game Jolt parser

sub-events.comment: First construct (haha) the link from what exactly is being requested, while also passing all the required login info, then make a signature by encrypting that link with MD5, then paste that signature into your link, and bam you got yourself an API request

variable.comment: Usually you don't want to change that, unless a new API version released
variable.name: BaseURL

variable.comment: MD5 Encrypt (Your link + game private key) = Signature
variable.name: Signature

sub-events.comment: Link scheme: Base URL - type of request - game ID - params (usually user credetentials) - additional params
Send off the request when it's time and remove it from queue
Periodically check if there's something in queue
Collect and record the response from API
Clear the response after it's been used

event-group.description: this is probably a bit overkill but whatever

Errors when got response

condition.name: Compare two values
condition.param: "You must enter an value with the request."

sub-events.comment: yes you are reading this correctly
=== Users
Special case for UsersAuth aka log in
UsersFetch can be used without logging in
=== Session
Status: active, idle
SessionCheck uses "success=false" as a way to tell you that the session doesn't exist yet
=== Data storage
if you want global data, don't include creditentials, if you want user specific data, include them
DataStoreFetch uses "success=false" as a way to tell you that the key doesn't exist yet
Operations: numbers: add, subtract, multiply, divide text: append, prepend
if key you're trying to update doesn't exists, it force creates it for convenience

event-group.description: things that GJ doesn't provide, but would be neat
event-group.title: Game Jolt API wrappers

sub-events.comment: Log out
Cache stuff so you won't need to make a request every time
Custom functions
Successfully logged in
Open a session (basically tell Game Jolt that you are online), also cache info for first use
Successfully opened session
GJ recommends pinging that you're still here every 30 seconds
set your online status, because GJ doesn't let you check exactly that

sub-events.comment: absolutely no harm intended
this is very crudely made, but it gets its job done
update session timers
if user user is not registered (aka first time playing), then do it and record the date
